Articles.Content:
There are myriad threads here filled with overwhelming praise and adoration for the devs, community and game, in general..

**AND THEY'RE ALL UNDERSTATEMENTS**

Greetings All;

I wanted to make my first post after lurking for a few weeks so I could introduce myself, and thank those who helped twist my arm into buying a pre-release game!

Steam - Without your sales, I never would've considered buying an "unfinished" game. A game that has already made such an impact in my life that my view of the world would be lesser without it.

Devs/Community - The devs brought to the world an amazing platform that allows (fairly) pure science the avenues to explore ALL of our collective creativity. What makes this game great is that it's an open universe, filled with open source objects: Objects conceived and constructed by the very people experiencing that universe. Objects that are newly available daily, FOR FREE, rather than quarterly for an obscene price. Each time I open the forum, game or spaceport I'm greeted with new and interesting content and rich discussions about physics, astronomy, math and so many other things for which I need my children to know about.

It is with great humility that I submit an album of pics from my first planned mission:

R-7 Semyorka Test Flight

Having run through the tutorials, I decided to make my first mission a test flight of what's widely considered to be the first ICBM (and the first rocket of the "space race"), the R-7 Semyorka!

I tried to take the shots at various points of interest to outline the mission. Feel free to comment/critique my handiwork or captions. The purpose of my creating these albums is to impress my kids (5 and 6) with the capabilities of KSP, and hopefully vault them into interests in physics, math, astronomy and other sciences as they get older.

Thanks again for everything, everyone.
